title: Awful photo shows snow-covered dog sat in back of moving truck during blizzard
text:
This poor malamute was spotted covered with snow in the back of a moving pickup truck during 17F weather in Colorado on Thursday. Although technically not breaking any laws, the dog’s unidentified owner could be charged with animal cruelty (Pictures: KDVR)

A harrowing photograph shows a snow-covered malamute sat in the back of a moving pickup truck during 16F (-8C) weather.

The miserable-looking dog was spotted by a fellow driver during a snowstorm in Parker, Colorado, on Thursday morning.

She shared the snap online, where it was widely shared, with many condemning the driver of the red pickup for subjecting the animal to such cruelty.

And while many commenters said the dog was bred to withstand cold conditions, veterinarian Dr Missy Tasky said the animal was still at risk of frostbite.

She told KDVR: ‘That’s just a recipe for disaster.

‘That breed of dog can withstand extreme temperatures, extreme cold better than the average dog. But in general, just like for people, they can get frostbite

‘It’s just not an ideal situation for that guy.

‘In that situation, where there’s nowhere for him to go, it could be very problematic.

KDVR reported that with windchill factored in, the dog may have been experiencing temperatures that felt closer to 0F (-18C).

Driving with a dog in the back of a truck is legal in Colorado, even if the vehicle’s tailgate open.

But a spokesman for Colorado State Patrol means the combination of circumstances could still see the driver, who has not been identified, charged with animal cruelty.

They explained: ‘The law is not cut and dry on this but the driver could be cited with a violation of animal cruelty if there was enough evidence.’

Officers have yet to say whether they are working to track down the truck’s driver to question them about their behavior.
description: The dog, believed to be a malamute, was snapped looking miserable as its owner drove through a freezing Colorado snow storm
